edu.ucla.belief.ace

Class OnlineEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucla.belief.ace.OnlineEngine

  • public class OnlineEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    An inference engine based on an arithmetic circuit compiled for a Bayesian network. Once constructed, an OnlineEngine can answer multiple probabilistic queries efficiently. For given evidence e, we can compute Pr (e) by performing a bottom-up traversal of the circuit, called evaluating the circuit, in time that is linear in the size of the circuit. We can also compute answers to many additional queries by performing a second top-down pass, called differentiating the circuit, again in time that is linear in the size of the circuit. All of these queries can therefore be computed in time that is linear in the size of the circuit, though the constant factor can be significantly smaller when only evaluating the circuit. Moreover, this process may be repeated for as many different evidence sets as desired.

    When only evaluating the circuit and not differentiating, and when there is a need to evaluate multiple times, it is possible to improve efficiency by refraining from evaluating parts of the circuit known to have not changed since the previous evaluation. This behavior is not implemented currently in this class.

    Author:
    Mark Chavira

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OnlineEngine(java.io.Reader acReader, java.io.Reader lmReader)
      Reads an online engine from the first given reader, reads a literal map from the second given reader, and constructs an online engine linked to the read arithmetic circuit and to the read literal map.
      OnlineEngine(java.lang.String acFilename, java.lang.String lmFilename)
      Reads an arithmetic circuit from the file with the first given name, reads a literal map from the file with the second given name, and constructs an online engine linked to the read arithmetic circuit and to the read literal map.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OnlineEngine

        public OnlineEngine(java.lang.String acFilename,
            java.lang.String lmFilename)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads an arithmetic circuit from the file with the first given name, reads a literal map from the file with the second given name, and constructs an online engine linked to the read arithmetic circuit and to the read literal map. This method runs in time that is linear in the size of the arithmetic circuit. However, the constant factor is large, since data is read from disk.
        Parameters:
        acFilename - the first given name.
        lmFilename - the second given name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • OnlineEngine

        public OnlineEngine(java.io.Reader acReader,
            java.io.Reader lmReader)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads an online engine from the first given reader, reads a literal map from the second given reader, and constructs an online engine linked to the read arithmetic circuit and to the read literal map. This method runs in time that is linear in the size of the arithmetic circuit. However, the constant factor is large, since data is read from disk.
        Parameters:
        acReader - the first given reader.
        lmReader - the second given reader.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

    • Method Detail

      • varForName

        public Variable varForName(java.lang.String n)
        Returns the variable having the given name. This method is fairly efficient, merely performing a lookup in a HashMap using a string key. However, there is some overhead, so if at all possible, all calls to this method should be made during initialization, and the method should be called at most once per variable rather than once (or multiple times) per evidence set. This method runs in time that is linear in the size of the given name.
        Parameters:
        n - the given name.
        Returns:
        the corresponding variable.

      • potForName

        public Potential potForName(java.lang.String n)
        Returns the potential having the given name. This method is fairly efficient, merely performing a lookup in a HashMap using a string key. However, there is some overhead, so if at all possible, all calls to this method should be made during initialization, and the method should be called at most once per potential rather than once (or multiple times) per evidence set. This method runs in time that is linear in the size of the given name.
        Parameters:
        n - the given name.
        Returns:
        the corresponding potential.

      • variables

        public java.util.Set<Variable> variables()
        Returns an unmodifiable set of the variables. This method runs in constant time.
        Returns:
        the variables.

      • potentials

        public java.util.Set<Potential> potentials()
        Returns an unmodifiable set of the potentials. This method runs in constant time.
        Returns:
        the variables.

      • assertEvidence

        public void assertEvidence(Evidence e,
                  boolean secondPass)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Evaluates the arithmetic circuit under the given evidence, computing probability of evidence; if the given flag is set, also differentiates the arithmetic circuit. The results of the upward pass may be retrieved by calling probOfEvidence(). The result of the second pass may be retrieved by calling any of the following:
        • varPartials(Variable)
        • varMarginals(Variable)
        • varPosteriors(Variable)
        • potPartials(Potential)
        • potMarginals(Potential)
        • potPosteriors(Potential)
        • varPartials(Set)
        • varMarginals(Set)
        • varPosteriors(Set)
        • potPartials(Set)
        • potMarginals(Set)
        • potPosteriors(Set)
        This method is the only publically available method that performs online inference. The method runs in time that is linear in the size of the arithmetic circuit. The constant factor is larger when performing the second pass.
        Parameters:
        e - the given evidence.
        secondPass - the given flag.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • probOfEvidence

        public double probOfEvidence()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns Pr (e) where e is defined by the most recent invocation of assertEvidence (). assertEvidence () must have been called prior to calling this method. The method performs no inference. It merely retrieves the results of inference performed when assertEvidence () was invoked. This method runs in constant time.
        Returns:
        the probability of evidence.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • varPartials

        public double[] varPartials(Variable v)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        For each value of the given network variable, returns the partial derivative of the ac with respect to the indicator for this value, according to the most recent invocation of assertEvidence (). The result is in the form of a double[] that maps network variable value to partial derivative. This method runs in time that is linear in the domain size of the given network variable.

        assertEvidence () must have been called prior to calling this method, and the most recent invocation of assertEvidence () must have set the secondPass flag. This method performs no inference. It merely retrieves the results of inference performed when assertEvidence () was invoked. This method runs in time that is linear in the domain size of the given network variable.

        Parameters:
        v - the given network variable.
        Returns:
        the posterior marginal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • varPartials

        public java.util.HashMap<Variable,double[]> varPartials(java.util.Set<Variable> vs)
                                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Invokes varPartials(Variable) for each given variable and returns the results.
        Parameters:
        vs - the given set of network variables.
        Returns:
        a map from each of the given network variables to its marginal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • varMarginals

        public double[] varMarginals(Variable v)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns the marginal Pr (X, e) for the given network variable X, where e is defined by the most recent invocation of assertEvidence (). The result is in the form of a double[] that maps network variable value to probability. This method runs in time that is linear in the domain size of the given network variable.

        assertEvidence () must have been called prior to calling this method, and the most recent invocation of assertEvidence () must have set the secondPass flag. This method performs no inference. It merely retrieves the results of inference performed when assertEvidence () was invoked. This method runs in time that is linear in the domain size of the given network variable.

        Parameters:
        v - the given network variable.
        Returns:
        the marginal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • varMarginals

        public java.util.HashMap<Variable,double[]> varMarginals(java.util.Set<Variable> vs)
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Invokes varMarginals(Variable) for each given variable and returns the results.
        Parameters:
        vs - the given set of network variables.
        Returns:
        a map from each of the given network variables to its marginal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • varPosteriors

        public double[] varPosteriors(Variable v)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns the posterior marginal Pr (X | e) for the given network variable X, where e is defined by the most recent invocation of assertEvidence (). The result is in the form of a double[] that maps network variable value to probability. This method runs in time that is linear in the domain size of the given variable.

        assertEvidence () must have been called prior to calling this method, and the most recent invocation of assertEvidence () must have set the secondPass flag. This method performs no inference. It merely retrieves the results of inference performed when assertEvidence () was invoked. This method runs in time that is linear in the domain size of the given network variable.

        Parameters:
        v - the given network variable.
        Returns:
        the posterior marginal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • varPosteriors

        public java.util.HashMap<Variable,double[]> varPosteriors(java.util.Set<Variable> vs)
                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Invokes varPosteriors(Variable) for each given variable and returns the results.
        Parameters:
        vs - the given set of network variables.
        Returns:
        a map from each of the given network variables to its marginal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • potPartials

        public double[] potPartials(Potential pot)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        For each position of the given network potential, returns the partial derivative of the ac with respect to the parameter for this position, according to the most recent invocation of assertEvidence (). The result is in the form of a double[] that maps position to partial derivative. This method runs in time that is linear in the number of positions of the given potential.

        assertEvidence () must have been called prior to calling this method, and the most recent invocation of assertEvidence () must have set the secondPass flag. This method performs no inference. It merely retrieves the results of inference performed when assertEvidence () was invoked. Warning: certain encodings that make use of local structure suppress the generation of a parameter variable for some positions or are capable of producing a parameter variable that represents multiple positions. Obtaining derivatives for these positions is not possible, and Double.NaN will be returned instead.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • potPartials

        public java.util.HashMap<Potential,double[]> potPartials(java.util.Set<Potential> ps)
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Invokes (Potential) potPartials(Potential) for each given potential and returns the results.
        Parameters:
        ps - the given potentials.
        Returns:
        the derivatives.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • potMarginals

        public double[] potMarginals(Potential p)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        For the given potential T, returns P (T, e) where e is defined by the most recent invocation of assertEvidence (). The result is in the form of a double[] that maps position to marginal. This method runs in time that is linear in the number of positions of the given potential.

        assertEvidence () must have been called prior to calling this method, and the most recent invocation of assertEvidence () must have set the secondPass flag. This method performs no inference. It merely retrieves the results of inference performed when assertEvidence () was invoked. Warning: certain encodings that make use of local structure suppress the generation of a parameter variable for some positions or are capable of producing a parameter variable that represents multiple positions. Obtaining derivatives for these positions is not possible, and Double.NaN will be returned instead.

        Parameters:
        p - the given potential.
        Returns:
        the margtinal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • potMarginals

        public java.util.HashMap<Potential,double[]> potMarginals(java.util.Set<Potential> ps)
                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Invokes (Potential) potMarginals(Potential) for each given potential and returns the results.
        Parameters:
        ps - the given potentials.
        Returns:
        the marginals.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • potPosteriors

        public double[] potPosteriors(Potential p)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        For the given potential T, returns P (T | e) where e is defined by the most recent invocation of assertEvidence (). The result is in the form of a double[] that maps position to posterior marginal. This method runs in time that is linear in the number of positions of the given potential.

        assertEvidence () must have been called prior to calling this method, and the most recent invocation of assertEvidence () must have set the secondPass flag. This method performs no inference. It merely retrieves the results of inference performed when assertEvidence () was invoked. Warning: certain encodings that make use of local structure suppress the generation of a parameter variable for some positions or are capable of producing a parameter variable that represents multiple positions. Obtaining derivatives for these positions is not possible, and Double.NaN will be returned instead.

        Parameters:
        v - the given variable.
        Returns:
        the posterior marginal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • potPosteriors

        public java.util.HashMap<Potential,double[]> potPosteriors(java.util.Set<Potential> ps)
                                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Invokes (Potential) potPosteriors(Potential) for each given potentials and returns the results.
        Parameters:
        vs - the given variables.
        Returns:
        the posterior marginals.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
